title: Dorsey, Zuckerberg grilled over censorship concerns
text: FOX Business' Susan Li and Axios Technology editor Kyle Daly discuss the Big Tech hearings on Facebook and Twitter's censorship. #FoxBusiness Subscribe to Fox Business!

title: Facebook and Twitter defend election safeguards and moderation practices before the Senate
text: Mark Zuckerberg and Jack Dorsey appeared before the Senate Tuesday at a hearing entitled "Breaking the News: Censorship, Suppression, and the 2020 Election."

title: Key takeaways from the hearing, by the numbers.
text: Content moderation came up the most. Republicans asked more questions.

title: Republican Senators Accuse Facebook, Twitter CEOs Of Censorship, As Democrats Assailed Them For Misinformation
text: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg and Twitter's Jack Dorsey faced questions about their handling of election-related content.

title: Lawmakers drill down on how Facebook and Twitter moderate content.
text: The issue of how the social media companies sort through content dominated the hearing.

title: Jack Dorsey says social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook can be addictive — Mark Zuckerberg says the research is 'inconclusive' (TWTR)
text: Social media platforms like Twitter and Facebook can be addictive, according to Jack Dorsey.  During Tuesday's hearing before the Senate Judiciary Committee to discuss issues pertaining to content moderation and the 2020 election, both Dorsey and Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg were questioned by Sen. Lindsey Graham on whether the platforms they built have the ability to become addicting for the customers who use them.

title: Instagram reportedly weighs sharing ad revenue with publishers
text: Instagram is reportedly weighing plans to share some of its advertising revenue with publishers who are helping turn the platform into a hub for news content. The plan under consideration would see the Facebook-owned social network give outlets a cut of the ad sales from clips they post to Instagram's IGTV video platform, Axios reported.

title: Zuckerberg: We would benefit from clearer guidance from elected officials
text: CNBC's Ylan Mui reports on Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's and Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey's testimony on the 2020 election to the Senate Judiciary Committee.

title: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey testify before the Senate on Section 230

title: Facebook CEO and Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey are testifying before Senate—Here's what they've discussed
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey are testifying before Senate about the 2020 election. CNBC's Julia Boorstin reports on the highlights from the testimony.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg: There is a role for regulation to play
text: Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey testify before a Senate panel. Senator Lindsey Graham of South Carolina asks if they agree on the approach for content moderation.

title: Facebook's Zuckerberg, Twitter's Dorsey face more congressional heat over content
text: The highly partisan video hearing offered Republicans another chance to laser-focus on the platforms' "censorship and suppression of New York Post articles and provide a valuable opportunity to review the companies' handling of the 2020 election," according to Graham.

title: Facebook, Twitter CEOs defend content decisions before lawmakers
text: The executives appear before senators in a hearing about the 2020 US election.

title: Twitter and Facebook CEOs testify before lawmakers in wake of election – live
text: Jack Dorsey and Mark Zuckerberg grilled by Senate judiciary committee on allegations of anti-conservative bias and handling of election

title: Mark Zuckerberg and Jack Dorsey testify before the Senate Tuesday — here's what they'll say
text: The hearing is expected to focus on the platforms' role in spreading and cracking down on messages related to this year's elections.

title: Jack Dorsey, Mark Zuckerberg face Senate hearing over censorship concerns
text: The Big Tech titans face another grilling over accusations of censorship during a Senate hearing Tuesday. Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and Facebook honcho Mark Zuckerberg are testifying before the Senate Judiciary Committee after their companies came under a firestorm of criticism for blocking The Post's exposé on Hunter Biden's business dealings in Ukraine and China.

title: WATCH LIVE: Twitter and Facebook CEOs testify before Senate Judiciary Committee — 11/17/2020
text: The Senate Judiciary Committee will hear from the Jack Dorsey, CEO of Twitter, and Mark Zuckerberg, CEO of Facebook, on allegations of anti-conservative bias on Tuesday. This comes after Zuckerberg, Dorsey and Google CEO Sundar Pichai testified before the Senate Commerce Committee last month on Section 230.

title: If Mark Zuckerberg repeats himself, don't be surprised.
text: Facebook's chief executive has appeared in front of lawmakers so many times that he has become a pro at handling questions.

title: LIVE: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey and Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg testify on Capitol Hill

title: Twitter and Facebook CEOs to testify before Senate Judiciary Committee
text: The Senate Judiciary Committee will hear from the CEOs of Twitter and Facebook on allegations of anti-conservative bias. CNBC's Ylan Mui reports.

title: U.S. Tech Hearings: Equating censorship with content moderation is 'dangerous,' policy expert says
text: Chris Lewis, President and CEO of the non-profit organization Public Knowledge, discusses what to expect ahead of the senate hearings with the CEOs of Facebook and Twitter.

title: Facebook, Twitter CEO's to testify Tuesday to U.S. Senate panel over content moderation decisions
text: The chief executives of Facebook and Twitter are set to testify before a congressional hearing on Tuesday that will explore their content moderation practices as Republicans accuse social media companies of censoring conservative speech.

title: Twitter and Facebook CEOs to testify on alleged anti-conservative bias
text: Senate hearing was called in response to how the companies' platforms handled a New York Post article about Joe Biden

title: Facebook, Twitter CEOs Expected To Defend Election Handing Before Senate Again Today
text: Facebook, Inc (NASDAQ: FB) CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Twitter Inc (NYSE: TWTR) CEO Jack Dorsey will be testifying before a Senate panel on Tuesday to defend the handling of disinformation during the U.S. Presidential election, the Associated Press reports. What Happened: The congressional hearing on Tuesday will be the second virtual appearance for the social media CEOs in less than three weeks.

title: What to Expect in Senate Hearing With Zuckerberg and Dorsey
text: The executives, who have now testified several times in recent years, will most likely face some new questions about how they handled the election.
